an10.167:4.1: Now, at that time it was the sabbath. The brahmin Jāṇussoṇi had bathed his head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes. Holding a handful of fresh grass, he stood to one side not far from the Buddha.
an10.167:5.1: Now, at that time it was the sabbath. The brahmin Jāṇussoṇi had bathed his head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes. Holding a handful of fresh grass, he stood to one side not far from the Buddha.
an10.167:5.3: “Brahmin, why have you bathed your head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes? Why are you standing to one side holding a handful of fresh grass?
an10.167:5.4: What’s going on today with the brahmin clan?”
an10.167:5.5: “Master Gotama, today is the ceremony of descent for the brahmin clan.”
an10.167:6.1: “But how do the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent?”
an10.167:6.2: “Well, Master Gotama, on the sabbath the brahmins bathe their heads and dress in a new pair of linen robes. They make a heap of fresh cow dung and spread it with green grass. Then they make their beds between the boundary and the fire chamber.
an10.167:6.3: That night they rise three times and worship the fire with cupped hands:
an10.167:6.5: And they serve the fire with abundant ghee, oil, and butter.
an10.167:6.6: And when the night has passed they serve the brahmins with a variety of delicious foods.
an10.167:6.7: That’s how the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent.”
an10.167:7.1: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the noble one.”
an10.167:7.2: “But how, Master Gotama, is the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the noble one?
an10.167:7.3: Master Gotama, please teach me this.”
an10.167:8.1: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention,
an10.167:9.2: ‘Killing living creatures has a bad result both in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:9.3: Reflecting like this, they give up killing living creatures,
an10.167:9.4: they descend from killing living creatures.
an10.167:10.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:10.3: Reflecting like this, they give up stealing,
an10.167:11.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:11.3: Reflecting like this, they give up sexual misconduct,
an10.167:12.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:12.3: Reflecting like this, they give up lying,
an10.167:13.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:13.3: Reflecting like this, they give up divisive speech,
an10.167:14.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:14.3: Reflecting like this, they give up harsh speech,
an10.167:15.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:15.3: Reflecting like this, they give up meaningless speech,
an10.167:16.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:16.3: Reflecting like this, they give up covetousness,
an10.167:17.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:17.3: Reflecting like this, they give up ill will,
an10.167:18.2: in the present life and in lives to come.’
an10.167:18.3: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong view,
an10.167:18.5: This is the ceremony of descent in the training of the noble one.”
an10.167:19.1: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the noble one.
an10.167:19.2: And, Master Gotama, the ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is not worth a sixteenth part of a master of the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the noble one.
an10.167:19.4: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
